publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-830# David Mundell: Racing Pigeons-That the Parliament notes the report of the UK Raptor Working Group; notes the concerns of the Scottish Homing Union and other pigeon fanciers in Scotland on the impact that raptors are having on their sport, and believes that the Scottish Executive and all interested parties should work together to ensure the appropriate protection of both raptors and racing pigeons so as to enable the continuation of pigeon racing as a sport in Scotland. Supported by: Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-830# Racing Pigeons (lodged on 10 May 2000) Allan Wilson*, Mr Brian Monteith*

S1M-830# David Mundell: Racing Pigeons-That the Parliament notes the report of the UK Raptor Working Group; notes the concerns of the Scottish Homing Union and other pigeon fanciers in Scotland on the impact that raptors are having on their sport, and believes that the Scottish Executive and all interested parties should work together to ensure the appropriate protection of both raptors and racing pigeons so as to enable the continuation of pigeon racing as a sport in Scotland. Supported by: Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Allan Wilson, Mr Brian Monteith
S1M-830# Racing Pigeons (lodged on 10 May 2000) Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-830# Racing Pigeons (lodged on 10 May 2000) Nick Johnston*
S1M-830# Racing Pigeons (lodged on 10 May 2000) Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S1M-830# David Mundell: Racing Pigeons—That the Parliament notes the report of the UK Raptor Working Group; notes the concerns of the Scottish Homing Union and other pigeon fanciers in Scotland on the impact that raptors are having on their sport, and believes that the Scottish Executive and all interested parties should work together to ensure the appropriate protection of both raptors and racing pigeons so as to enable the continuation of pigeon racing as a sport in Scotland. Supported by: Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Allan Wilson, Mr Brian Monteith, Cathy Jamieson, Nick Johnston, Mr Jamie McGrigor
S1M-830# Racing Pigeons (lodged on 10 May 2000) Margaret Jamieson*
S1M-830# Racing Pigeons (lodged on 10 May 2000) Alex Neil*
S1M-830# Racing Pigeons (lodged on 10 May 2000) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-830# David Mundell: Racing Pigeons—That the Parliament notes the report of the UK Raptor Working Group; notes the concerns of the Scottish Homing Union and other pigeon fanciers in Scotland on the impact that raptors are having on their sport, and believes that the Scottish Executive and all interested parties should work together to ensure the appropriate protection of both raptors and racing pigeons so as to enable the continuation of pigeon racing as a sport in Scotland. Supported by: Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Allan Wilson, Mr Brian Monteith, Cathy Jamieson, Nick Johnston, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Margaret Jamieson, Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie
S1M-830# Racing Pigeons (lodged on 10 May 2000) Mary Scanlon*, Ben Wallace*

S1M-830# David Mundell: Racing Pigeons-That the Parliament notes the report of the UK Raptor Working Group; notes the concerns of the Scottish Homing Union and other pigeon fanciers in Scotland on the impact that raptors are having on their sport, and believes that the Scottish Executive and all interested parties should work together to ensure the appropriate protection of both raptors and racing pigeons so as to enable the continuation of pigeon racing as a sport in Scotland. Supported by: Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Allan Wilson, Mr Brian Monteith, Cathy Jamieson, Nick Johnston, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Margaret Jamieson, Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie, Mary Scanlon, Ben Wallace, Alex Fergusson*
S1M-830# Racing Pigeons (lodged on 10 May 2000) Fergus Ewing*, Mr Keith Harding*

Supported by: Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Allan Wilson, Mr Brian Monteith, Cathy Jamieson, Nick Johnston, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Margaret Jamieson, Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie, Mary Scanlon, Ben Wallace, Alex Fergusson, Fergus Ewing, Mr Keith Harding, Phil Gallie*
